stories.title: SK Hynix Announces Its First HBM3 Memory: 24GB Stacks, Clocked at Up to 6.4Gbps

stories.text: I need some articles with respect to why key rotation does very little to improve security overall. Given that NIST recommends 1-2 years and others recommend shorter windows, this still gives a disgruntled employee or some other attacker a LOT of time to hack you if they have an API key. Does anyone have links to good articles/blogs/white-papers/research about this problem?
stories.title: Ask HN: Articles about key rotation being worthless
The Potato and the Satiety Index

Australia is putting a rover on the Moon in 2024 to search for water

stories.text:
In an interview about literate programming (the concept that programs are not just written for computers to read, but for humans to read too), Knuth said that he hoped that one day there would be a Pulitzer prize for programs.

If there would be one, which piece of code do you think would deserve it?
stories.title: Ask HN: What piece of code could deserve a Pulitzer prize?
We Are “Solving the Overlooked with Data”
